title: Summer Leys Nature Reserve Great Doddington Walking Route

images.title: Alan Murray-Rust / Car park, Summer Leys Nature Reserve
images.caption: Car park, Summer Leys Nature Reserve. The reserve is based on lagoons left from aggregate extraction.

images.title: Alan Murray-Rust / Northern lagoon, Summer Leys Reserve
images.caption: Northern lagoon. The view north from one of the many birdwatching hides. This one provides a good range of small birds in the scrubland in the foreground as well as longer views across the lagoon.

images.title: Alan Murray-Rust / Butterfly Conservation Meadow
images.caption: Butterfly Conservation Meadow. A variety of management techniques are used at Summer Leys Nature Reserve, including grazing and coppicing, to maintain a wide diversity of wildlife.

images.title: Paul Mills / Summer Leys Nature Reserve
images.caption: Summer Leys Nature Reserve

images.title: Alan Murray-Rust / Weir for Wollaston Mill and lock
images.caption: Weir for Wollaston Mill and lock. Located just to the west of the reserve. The weir maintains the level of the navigation channel for Wollaston Mill Lock, and would formerly have performed a similar function for the mill.

images.title: Kokai / Hardwater Mill
images.caption: Hardwater Mill. Also just west of the reserve, this mill sits in a picturesque location on the River Nene.

images.title: Alan Murray-Rust / Platelayers hut
images.caption: Platelayers hut on the old railway on the western side of the site. This would have provided shelter for the lengthsman maintaining the railway track when this was still an operating railway. Note also the surviving traditional telegraph pole. The railway ran from Northampton to Peterborough.

description: This walk explores the Summer Leys Nature Reserve and the countryside around the village of Great Doddington near Wellingborough in Northamptonshire. The reserve has some nice easy access trails taking your around wildlife rich wetlands and grassland. After exploring the reserve you can head into the village of Great Doddington and pick up the Nene Way. This long distance waymarked footpath could be used to extend the route by heading south west along the riverside path towards Earls Barton. If you follow the river path north it will take you towards Irchester Country Park where there are some pleasant woodland walks to enjoy.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: There are several other nature reserves to visit in the immediate area. Rushden Lakes, Stanwick Lakes and Titchmarsh Nature Reserve are all nearby and well worth a visit. For more walking ideas in the area see the Northamptonshire Walks page.

display_address: Hardwater Road, Wollaston, North Northamptonshire, England, NN29 7PT, United Kingdom
